    • Constructor Detail

      • Connect

        protected Connect()

      • Connect

        public Connect(@NonNull
               ConnectionOptions options)
        Connect module constructor.

        This module spawns threads for retrieving notifications when daemon is started @see startNotifications().

        By default, the executor services in charge are defined and managed internally. It is however possible to specify your own executors @see #Connect(ConnectionOptions, ExecutorService, ExecutorService).

        Parameters:
        options - connection options @see ConnectionOptions.

      • Connect

        public Connect(SdkContext context)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        context - SDK context

      • Connect

        public Connect(@NonNull
               ConnectionOptions options,
               @Nullable
               java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService notificationHandlingThreadPool,
               @Nullable
               java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService notificationPullingThreadPool)
        Connect module constructor.

        As opposed to Connect(ConnectionOptions) which uses default thread pools for retrieving notifications, this constructor lets you the possibility to specify the executor services to use.

        Parameters:
        options - connection options @see ConnectionOptions.
        notificationHandlingThreadPool - Threads in charge of retrieving notifications for a specific resource. If null, a default thread pool will be created internally.
        notificationPullingThreadPool - Threads in charge of listening to notifications. The pool can either be a scheduled thread pool or a fixed thread pool depending on what best suits your system. If null, an internal timer will be created internally.

      • startNotifications

        @API
 @Daemon(task="Listen to notification",
        start=true)
public void startNotifications()
                                                                                            throws MbedCloudException
        Starts notification pull.

        If an external callback is not set up (using `update_webhook`) then calling this function is mandatory to get or set resources. Unless ConnectionOptions.setAutostartDaemon(boolean) has been set to true or left as default.

        Throws:
        MbedCloudException - if a problem occurred during the process.

      • getResourceValueAsync

        @API
 @Deprecated
 @Nullable
public java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Object> getResourceValueAsync(@NonNull
                                                                                                           java.lang.String deviceId,
                                                                                                           @NonNull
                                                                                                           java.lang.String resourcePath,
                                                                                                           @DefaultValue(value="false")
                                                                                                           boolean cacheOnly,
                                                                                                           @DefaultValue(value="false")
                                                                                                           boolean noResponse)
                                                                                                    throws MbedCloudException
        Deprecated. 
        Gets a resource value for a given device id and resource path.

        Example: 

         
 try {
     String deviceId = "015f4ac587f500000000000100100249";
     String resourcePath = "/3201/0/5853";
     Future<Object> futureLedPattern = connectApi.getResourceValueAsync(deviceId, resourcePath, false, false);
     String ledPattern = (String)futureLedPattern.get();
     System.out.println("LED pattern from device: " + ledPattern);
 } catch (MbedCloudException e) {
     e.printStackTrace();
 }
        Parameters:
        deviceId - The name/id of the device.
        resourcePath - The resource path to get.
        cacheOnly - If true, the response will come only from the cache.
        noResponse - If true, Pelion Device Connector will not wait for a response.
        Returns:
        A Future from which it is possible to obtain resource value.
        Throws:
        MbedCloudException - if a problem occurred during request processing.

      • getResourceValueAsync

        @API
 @Nullable
public java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Object> getResourceValueAsync(@NonNull
                                                                                             java.lang.String deviceId,
                                                                                             @NonNull
                                                                                             java.lang.String resourcePath)
                                                                                      throws MbedCloudException
        Gets a resource value for a given device id and resource path.

        Example: 

         
 try {
     String deviceId = "015f4ac587f500000000000100100249";
     String resourcePath = "/3201/0/5853";
     Future<Object> futureLedPattern = connectApi.getResourceValueAsync(deviceId, resourcePath);
     String ledPattern = (String)futureLedPattern.get();
     System.out.println("LED pattern from device: " + ledPattern);
 } catch (MbedCloudException e) {
     e.printStackTrace();
 }
        Parameters:
        deviceId - The name/id of the device.
        resourcePath - The resource path to get.
        Returns:
        A Future from which it is possible to obtain resource value.
        Throws:
        MbedCloudException - if a problem occurred during request processing.

      • getResourceValueAsync

        @API
 @Deprecated
 @Nullable
public java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Object> getResourceValueAsync(@NonNull
                                                                                                           Resource resource,
                                                                                                           @DefaultValue(value="false")
                                                                                                           boolean cacheOnly,
                                                                                                           @DefaultValue(value="false")
                                                                                                           boolean noResponse)
                                                                                                    throws MbedCloudException
        Deprecated. 
        Gets a resource value for a given device id and resource path.

        Example: 

         
 try {
     Device device = new Device();
     device.setId("015f4ac587f500000000000100100249");
     String resourcePath = "/3201/0/5853";
     Resource resource = connectApi.getResource(device, resourcePath);
    
     Future<Object> futureLedPattern = connectApi.getResourceValueAsync(resource, false, false);
     String ledPattern = (String)futureLedPattern.get();
     System.out.println("LED pattern from device: " + ledPattern);
 } catch (MbedCloudException e) {
     e.printStackTrace();
 }
        Parameters:
        resource - The resource to get the value of.
        cacheOnly - If true, the response will come only from the cache.
        noResponse - If true, Pelion Device Connector will not wait for a response.
        Returns:
        A Future from which it is possible to obtain resource value.
        Throws:
        MbedCloudException - if a problem occurred during request processing.

      • setResourceValueAsync

        @API
 @Deprecated
 @Nullable
public java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Object> setResourceValueAsync(@NonNull
                                                                                                           java.lang.String deviceId,
                                                                                                           @NonNull
                                                                                                           java.lang.String resourcePath,
                                                                                                           @Nullable
                                                                                                           java.lang.String resourceValue,
                                                                                                           @DefaultValue(value="false")
                                                                                                           boolean noResponse)
                                                                                                    throws MbedCloudException
        Deprecated. 
        Sets the value of a resource.

        Example: 

         
 try {
     String deviceId = "015f4ac587f500000000000100100249";
     String resourcePath = "/3201/0/5853";
     String resourceValue = "500:500:500";

     Future<Object> futureLedPattern = connectApi.setResourceValueAsync(deviceId, resourcePath, resourceValue, false);
     String setValue = (String)futureLedPattern.get();
     assert setValue == resourceValue;
 } catch (MbedCloudException e) {
     e.printStackTrace();
 }
        Parameters:
        deviceId - The name/id of the device.
        resourcePath - The resource path to get.
        resourceValue - value to set.
        noResponse - If true, Pelion Device Connector will not wait for a response.
        Returns:
        A Future from which it is possible to set the value.
        Throws:
        MbedCloudException - if a problem occurred during request processing.

      • executeResourceAsync

        @Deprecated
 @API
 @Nullable
public java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Object> executeResourceAsync(@NonNull
                                                                                                          java.lang.String deviceId,
                                                                                                          @NonNull
                                                                                                          java.lang.String resourcePath,
                                                                                                          @Nullable
                                                                                                          java.lang.String functionName,
                                                                                                          @DefaultValue(value="false")
                                                                                                          boolean noResponse)
                                                                                                   throws MbedCloudException
        Deprecated. 
        Executes a function on a resource.

        Example: 

         
 try {
     String deviceId = "015f4ac587f500000000000100100249";
     String resourcePath = "/3201/0/5853";
     String functionName = null;

     Future<Object> resultObject = connectApi.executeResourceAsync(deviceId, resourcePath, functionName, false);
     String resultValue = (String)resultObject.get();
     System.out.println("Result from the function executed: " + resultValue);
 } catch (MbedCloudException e) {
     e.printStackTrace();
 }
        Parameters:
        deviceId - The name/id of the device.
        resourcePath - The resource path to get.
        functionName - The function to trigger.
        noResponse - If true, Pelion Device Connector will not wait for a response.
        Returns:
        A Future from which it is possible to get the value returned from the function executed on the resource.
        Throws:
        MbedCloudException - if a problem occurred during request processing.

      • getCurrentPresubscriptionRegistry

        protected GenericAdapter.MappedObjectRegistry<Presubscription> getCurrentPresubscriptionRegistry(java.lang.String methodName)
                                                                                          throws MbedCloudException
        Throws:
        MbedCloudException

      • listPresubscriptions

        @API
 @Nullable
public java.util.List<Presubscription> listPresubscriptions()
                                                                       throws MbedCloudException
        Lists pre-subscription data.

        Example: 

         
 try {
     List<Presubscription> presubscriptions = connectApi.listPresubscriptions();
     for (Presubscription presub : presubscriptions) {
         System.out.println("Device (" + presub.getDeviceId() + ") has subscriptions to resources: ");
         for (String resource : presub.getResourcePaths()) {
             System.out.println(resource);
         }
     }
 } catch (MbedCloudException e) {
     e.printStackTrace();
 }
        Returns:
        the list of pre-subscription data.
        Throws:
        MbedCloudException - if a problem occurred during request processing.

      • updatePresubscriptions

        @API
public void updatePresubscriptions(@Nullable
                                         java.util.List<Presubscription> presubscriptions)
                                  throws MbedCloudException
        Updates all pre-subscription data.

        Example: 

         
 try {
     String deviceId = "015f4ac587f500000000000100100249";

     Presubscription presub1 = new Presubscription();
     presub1.setDeviceType("default");
     List<String> resourceList1 = Arrays.asList("/3201/0/5850", "/3201/0/5853");
     presub1.setResourcePaths(resourceList1);

     Presubscription presub2 = new Presubscription();
     presub2.setDeviceId(deviceId);
     List<String> resourceList2 = Arrays.asList("/3200/0/5501");
     presub2.setResourcePaths(resourceList2);

     List<Presubscription> presubscriptions = Arrays.asList(presub1, presub2);
     connectApi.updatePresubscriptions(presubscriptions);
 } catch (MbedCloudException e) {
     e.printStackTrace();
 }
        Parameters:
        presubscriptions - The pre-subscription list to update.

        If you send an empty/null array, the pre-subscription data will be removed @see deletePresubscriptions() for similar action.

        Throws:
        MbedCloudException - if a problem occurred during request processing.

                                     Presubscription presubscription)

     e.printStackTrace();
 }

      • deleteSubscriptions

        @API
public void deleteSubscriptions()
                               throws MbedCloudException
        Removes all subscriptions.

        Note: this method will deregister all subscription callbacks or observers if any.

        Warning: Please note that this operation is potentially really expensive and hence, use wisely.

        It could be slow for large numbers of connected devices. If possible, explicitly delete subscriptions known to have been created.

        Throws:
        MbedCloudException - if a problem occurred during request processing.

      • deleteSubscribers

 @Deprecated
public void deleteSubscribers()
                                           throws MbedCloudException
        Deprecated. use deleteSubscriptions() instead.
        Removes all subscriptions.

        Throws:
        MbedCloudException - if a problem occurred during request processing.

      • addResourceSubscription

        @API
public void addResourceSubscription(@NonNull
                                          Resource resource)
                                   throws MbedCloudException
        Subscribes to a resource.

        Example: 

         
 try {
     String deviceId = "015f4ac587f500000000000100100249";
     String resourcePath = "/3200/0/5501";
     Resource buttonResource = new Resource(deviceId, resourcePath);

     connectApi.addResourceSubscription(buttonResource);
 } catch (MbedCloudException e) {
     e.printStackTrace();
 }
        Parameters:
        resource - resource to subscribe to.
        Throws:
        MbedCloudException - if a problem occurred during request processing.

      • addResourceSubscription

        @API
public void addResourceSubscription(@NonNull
                                          Resource resource,
                                          @NonNull
                                          Callback<java.lang.Object> onNotification,
                                          @Nullable
                                          Callback<java.lang.Throwable> onFailure)
                                   throws MbedCloudException
        Subscribes to a resource and associates callbacks.

        Example: 

         
 try {
     String deviceId = "015f4ac587f500000000000100100249";
     String resourcePath = "/3200/0/5501";
     Resource buttonResource = new Resource(deviceId, resourcePath);
     Callback<Object> callback = new Callback<Object>() {

         &#64;Override
         public void execute(Object arg) {
             System.out.println("Just received a notification from " + device.getId() + " regarding " + path
                     + ": " + String.valueOf(arg));

         }
     };
     connectApi.addResourceSubscription(resource,callback, null);
 } catch (MbedCloudException e) {
     e.printStackTrace();
 }
        Parameters:
        resource - resource to subscribe to.
        onNotification - callback to execute on notification.
        onFailure - callback to execute on error.
        Throws:
        MbedCloudException - if a problem occurred during request processing.

      • addResourceSubscription

        @API
 @Nullable
public io.reactivex.Flowable<NotificationMessageValue> addResourceSubscription(@NonNull
                                                                                                 Resource resource,
                                                                                                 @Nullable @DefaultValue(value="BUFFER")
                                                                                                 io.reactivex.BackpressureStrategy strategy)
                                                                                          throws MbedCloudException
        Subscribes to a resource and creates a related observer.

        Note: for more information about observers @see Reactive X or RxJava *

        Example: 

         {
  String resourcePath = "/3200/0/5501";
     String deviceId = "015f4ac587f500000000000100100249";
     Resource resource = new Resource(deviceId, path);
     connectApi.addResourceSubscription(resource, BackpressureStrategy.BUFFER)
                   .subscribe(System.out::println);
        Parameters:
        resource - resource to subscribe to.
        strategy - backpressure strategy to apply @see BackpressureStrategy
        Returns:
        Observable which can be subscribed to. @see Flowable
        Throws:
        MbedCloudException - if a problem occurred during request processing.

      • registerResourceSubscriptionCallback

        @API
public void registerResourceSubscriptionCallback(@NonNull
                                                       Resource resource,
                                                       @NonNull
                                                       Callback<java.lang.Object> onNotification,
                                                       @Nullable
                                                       Callback<java.lang.Throwable> onFailure)
                                                throws MbedCloudException
        Registers a subscription callback for a resource.

        Example: 

         {
  String resourcePath = "/3200/0/5501";
     String deviceId = "015f4ac587f500000000000100100249";
     Resource resource = new Resource(deviceId, path);
     Callback<Object> callback = new Callback<Object>() {

         &#64;Override
         public void execute(Object arg) {
             System.out.println("Just received a notification from " + device.getId() + " regarding " + path
                     + ": " + String.valueOf(arg));

         }
     };
     connectApi.registerResourceSubscriptionCallback(resource, callback, null);
     connectApi.addResourceSubscription(resource);
        Parameters:
        resource - resource to register the callback for.
        onNotification - callback to execute on notification.
        onFailure - callback to execute on error.
        Throws:
        MbedCloudException - if an error occurred in the process.

      • deregisterResourceSubscriptionCallback

        @API
public void deregisterResourceSubscriptionCallback(@NonNull
                                                         Resource resource)
                                                  throws MbedCloudException

 {
     @code
     String resourcePath = "/3200/0/5501";

     Resource resource = new Resource(deviceId, path);
     connectApi.deregisterResourceSubscriptionCallback(resource);
 }

        MbedCloudException - if an error occurred in the process.

      • createResourceSubscriptionObserver

        @API
 @Nullable
public io.reactivex.Flowable<NotificationMessageValue> createResourceSubscriptionObserver(@NonNull
                                                                                                            Resource resource,
                                                                                                            @Nullable @DefaultValue(value="BUFFER")
                                                                                                            io.reactivex.BackpressureStrategy strategy)
                                                                                                     throws MbedCloudException
        Creates an observer for resource subscriptions.

        Note: for more information about observers @see Reactive X or RxJava *

        Example: 

         {
  String resourcePath = "/3200/0/5501";
     String deviceId = "015f4ac587f500000000000100100249";
     Resource resource = new Resource(deviceId, path);
     connectApi.createResourceSubscriptionObserver(resource, BackpressureStrategy.BUFFER)
                   .subscribe(System.out::println);
     connectApi.addResourceSubscription(resource);
        Parameters:
        resource - resource to subscribe to.
        strategy - backpressure strategy to apply @see BackpressureStrategy
        Returns:
        Observable which can be subscribed to. @see Flowable
        Throws:
        MbedCloudException - if an error occurred in the process.

      • deleteWebhook

        @API
public void deleteWebhook()
                         throws MbedCloudException
        Deletes the callback data (effectively stopping Arm Pelion Cloud Connect from putting notifications).

        If no webhook is registered, an exception (404) will be raised.

        Note that every registered subscription will be deleted as part of deregistering a webhook.

        Throws:
        MbedCloudException - if a problem occurred during request processing.

      • clearAllNotificationChannels

        @API
public void clearAllNotificationChannels()
        Deletes any notification channel currently in use.

      • isForceClear

        public boolean isForceClear()
        States whether any existing notification channel should be cleared before a new one is created.

        Note: for more information, see ConnectionOptions.isForceClear()

        Returns:
        True if the channel will be cleared. False otherwise.

      • isSkipCleanup

        public boolean isSkipCleanup()
        States whether any existing notification channel and subscriptions will not be cleared on SDK exit.

        Note: for more information, see ConnectionOptions.isSkipCleanup()

        Returns:
        True if the clean-up will be skipped. False otherwise.

      • setForceClear

      • isAutostartDaemon

        public boolean isAutostartDaemon()
        States whether notification daemon will start automatically when needed.

        Note: to change this behaviour, use ConnectionOptions.setAutostartDaemon(boolean) when initialising this API.

        Returns:
        true if daemon will be started automatically. False otherwise.
